original_title: Cops open fire at fleeing motorcycle; Drug peddler arrested
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); One person sustained injuries when police opened fire at a motorcycle at the Hiriwadunna checkpoint in Rambukkana, for failing to comply with orders to stop.
Police said the roadblock was set up to arrest a drug peddler.
Police Spokesperson SSP Nihal Thalduwa said two suspects were traveling on the motorcycle, and they had sped off despite being signalled to stop, early on Wednesday (14) morning.
He said thereafter, police officers opened fire at the speeding motorcycle.
Even after being shot at, the suspects had managed to flee, and a police chase led to their arrest.
Sri Lanka Police said during the chase, the rider had lost control of the motorcycle and it crashed.
The suspect who was injured in the shooting, and the other suspect who was injured following the accident were admitted to the Kegalle Hospital, and they were identified as residents of Hiriwadunna.
Police Spokesperson SSP Nihal Thalduwa said that a police officer was also injured in the attempt that was made to stop the fleeing suspects.
Sri Lanka Police said the drug peddlers who was wanted by authorities was also arrested while attempting to pass through the checkpoint.
